required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Packed Red Blood Cell Transfusion on Eicosanoid Profiles in Plasma of Intensive Care Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Packed Red Blood Cell Transfusion on Eicosanoid Profiles in Plasma of Intensive Care Patients - a Pilot Study

brief_summary.textblock: The main goal of this pilot study is to assess the time course of eicosanoid profiles in intensive care unit (ICU) patients requiring packed red blood cell (PRBC) transfusion. Moreover we will analyze the change of levels of eicosanoids in patient plasma prior and after a PRBC transfusion as well as its correlation with levels of eicosanoids in the transfused PRBCs. These data will then be used to determine the estimated effect size necessary for the planning of future larger studies. We hypothesize that transfusion of PRBCs will modulate the eicosanoid profile in ICU patients.

primary_outcome.measure: Change of plasma eicosanoid concentrations in ICU patients subjected to PRBC Transfusion at any time Point compared to baseline
primary_outcome.time_frame: 60 minutes prior to 90 minutes after packed red blood cell transfusion

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes of plasma eicosanoid profiles after PRBC transfusion compared to prior to PRBC transfusion in ICU patients
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 60 minutes prior to 90 minutes after packed red blood cell transfusion

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation of plasma eicosanoid profiles in the transfused PRBCs and the change of their plasma levels in ICU patients
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 60 minutes prior to 90 minutes after packed red blood cell transfusion

arm_group.arm_group_label: Intensive care patients after elective open aortic surgery
Intensive care patients after bilateral lung transplantation
Anesthetic intensive care patients, unplanned admission

intervention.intervention_name: Analysis of eicosanoid profile prior to and after PRBC transfusion
intervention.description: Using liquid chromatography-mass spectrometry to analyze the eicosanoid profile in patient plasma and aliquoted of the PRBCs prior to and after PRBC transfusion.
intervention.arm_group_label: Anesthetic intensive care patients, unplanned admission
Intensive care patients after bilateral lung transplantation
Intensive care patients after elective open aortic surgery

study_pop.textblock: Group 1: routine postoperative ICU patients after open aortic surgery Group 2: routine postoperative ICU patients with immunosuppression after lung transplantation Group 3: mixed postoperative ICU patients

criteria.textblock:
Exclusion Criteria:
- Age <18 years or >99 years
- Pregnancy
- <12h since last PRBC transfusion
- intake/administration of acetylsalicylic acid in groups 2 and 3
- intake/administration of cysteinyl leukotriene receptor antagonists (e.g. montelukast)
- intake/administration of celecoxib, etoricoxib, parecoxib, ibuprofen, diclofenac, and naproxen in all groups
- glucocorticoids given within 24h of transfusion in groups 1 and 3
- treatment with calcineurin inhibitors (e.g. tacrolimus) in groups 1 and 3
- treatment with alemtuzumab in groups 1 and 3
- administration of protamine for heparin reversal in groups 2 and 3
